intro: Anthospermum scabrum, commonly known as rough anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, often rough-textured leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
